intro: Begonia angulata var. campos-portoi, commonly known as the São Paulo begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to Brazil. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves with prominent veins and striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
